h1: Providing the foundations and opportunities for the next generation to pursue their dreams.
about: Tokyo West International School (TWIS) is an international school affiliated with Global Step Academy  (GSA), which specializes in international education. TWIS consists of a kindergarten, an elementary school, and a middle school. We aim to help pave the way for children to succeed in the world.
program: Our program focuses on the development of the students’ abilities in five main areas: languages, mathematics, physical education, music, and presentation skills. We believe that just preparing the students for their university entrance exams is not enough, and most importantly it should not be the final aim of education. Education should provide young people with the tools they need to accomplish their life goals.
offers: TWIS students can register to take free online lessons every month with Global Step Academy. Students are able to take English classes and other classes taught in English such as mathematics to further improve their English skills.
boost: We offer a boost program for prospective students who need to develop their English skills in order to actively participate in the lessons at TWIS. Children who do not meet the administration criteria, but depending on their performance in the entrance examination, may be eligible to enroll into our school if they agree to participate in this program.
about-intro-p1: I was honored to be asked to take the position as Head of School from the school year 2017-2018. The school has been growing, and changing, every year since the start 8 years ago. With this year's new organizational restructure and merger with the GSA group, it is my belief that TWIS has taken a giant leap towards becoming a solid institution that truly promotes international minded education and global values.
about-intro-p2: A school's role in developing a child to be a lifelong learner cannot be underestimated. Changing the way students perceive their own abilities and potential could drastically alter their performance. Rather than praising students based on their talent or intelligence, they should be praised on the process of learning – the effort they put in and the strategies they use, as well as their focus, perseverance, and improvement. This is a role we take very seriously at TWIS. With the introduction of a new international curriculum framework, we will set our focus on these processes of teaching and learning.
about-intro-p3: Productive relationships between students and teachers form the bedrock of TWIS. Teachers design lessons that allow students to develop our core values - the 4Cs: 'curious (research) skills, 'collaborative (communication) skills', 'courageous (self-management) skills' and 'compassionate (open-mindedness) skills'. Ultimately, your children will be the architects of the 21st century with these skills. To stimulate and promote these skills, lessons are inquiry-based and experiential, require conceptual understanding, and focus on teamwork. Lessons are differentiated in order to make them accessible to the entire class. Local and global concepts and contexts are routinely explored to add depth to learning. Finally, both daily assessments (formative) and end-of-unit assessments (summative) inform all stakeholders of student achievement.
about-intro-p4: In addition, we will also include an extensive after school program, a new lunch time activity schedule, a summer school program, and out-of-classroom learning; all which makes a unique contribution to a child's education, and offers many varied benefits to them, not least developing the 'whole child' with a sense of place and wonder for the world around them. We strongly believe that academics must not be confined to the classroom, as there are many opportunities for students to extend their learning outside the classroom. After-school activities and outside-of-class activities allows your children to gain an understanding of what it means to live a 'balanced' life. A balanced life consists of intellectual, physical and emotional balance, which equals personal well-being. In this age of the smart phones and video games, activities outside of the classroom act as a counterbalance. So, we strive for our students to find this balanced lifestyle.
about-intro-p5: It is paramount that honesty and trust form the cornerstone of relationships throughout the school. A school of transparency will allow our mosaic of nationalities to shine even more brightly, and all the stakeholders involved in our school community to be a part of developing our school. If you wish to meet with a member of our administration or staff, then simply email the person in question for an appointment. The Parent Teacher Organization (PTO) also welcomes both new and old families to TWIS. The PTO is there to support all stakeholders in the school. It coordinates school events, fundraising, programs, and activities (both formal and informal). It is a great way for new and old families to form friendships. Matters related to the betterment of the educational experiences are routinely discussed. If you would like to discover more about the PTO, including membership in the PTO, please contact the PTO at pto.tokyowest@gmail.com for details.
about-intro-p6: I look forward to meeting with you and take on the educational challenges which lie ahead of us together.
about-head-p1: Tokyo West International School (TWIS) is an international school affiliated with Global Step Academy  (GSA), which specializes in international education.
about-head-p2: TWIS consists of a kindergarten, an elementary school, and a middle school. We aim to bring up children who will succeed in the world. In the elementary and middle school divisions, around 40% of the students come from different countries. This creates a rich, diverse environment that allows students to think in a global perspective and grow to become independent individuals, while developing their skills to understand and respect different cultures and people.
about-head-p3: Additionally, we focus our attention on long term community development, and understanding of diversity, as much as we do on language acquisition, communication skills, ethics, self-awareness, and mindfulness.
about-head-p4: We believe that extracurricular activities that parallel classroom lessons and the regular curriculum are important for the student’s development. We put our focus on sports, music, and other after school and club activities where children apply all sorts of skills they have learned in classrooms and put them to use in the process of learning. Learning through these activities allow students to understand what it is like to work both individually and in a group.
about-head-p5: The ultimate goal is that every student gains the fundamental skill sets and knowledge to become Global Citizens.
edu-policy-outcomes-p1: - attain, to the best of each individual's ability, high levels of understanding and competencies across a broad range of subjects
edu-policy-outcomes-p2: - attain the essential knowledge, skills and attitudes to be life-long learners through collaborative interaction with each other
edu-policy-outcomes-p3: - be curious and courageous independent learners, active in their approach to their own learning
edu-policy-outcomes-p4: - be compassionate international citizens of a changing and challenging world
edu-policy-advantage-highest: At TWIS, we demand the highest standards from all our constituents.
edu-policy-advantage-p1: - Included in a stimulating and caring learning environment.
edu-policy-advantage-p2: - Respected for the diverse cultures they represent.
edu-policy-advantage-p3: - Stimulated by a quality education and rigorous assessment.
edu-policy-faculty-p1: - Promote and support intellectual growth and excellence in all aspects of learning.
edu-policy-faculty-p3: - Make learning relevant, rigorous and real.
edu-policy-faculty-p4: - Utilize the most appropriate technology and resources available.
edu-policy-faculty-p5: - Be actively involved in professional development.
edu-policy-faculty-p6: - Provide a learning environment which enhances learning potential and encourages students to take responsibility for their own learning.
edu-policy-faculty-p7: - Foster respect and promote awareness and acceptance of personal and cultural diversity.
edu-policy-philosophy-title: TWIS Mission, Vision and Core Values
edu-policy-vision-p: To develop and support the unique potential of every student as they discover their passions and direction in an ever-changing world.
edu-policy-mission-p: To provide a challenging holistic international education, that is innovative and evolving, to children of all nationalities living in West Tokyo.
edu-policy-curious-p: in terms of seeking knowledge and answers to questions raised both inside and outside the classroom. Questioning the world around them along with their own personal convictions (critical-thinking and creative-thinking skills)
edu-policy-collaborative-p: in terms of reaching out to each other and sharing knowledge, while seeking understanding through group decision-making, respecting others, contributing to a harmonious learning environment (communication and transfer skills)
edu-policy-courage-p: in terms of taking risks within their academic and personal pursuits. Daring to push themselves out of their comfort zone and seek out new and unfamiliar challenges, while willing to do the planning, organization and time management needed (self-management skills)
edu-policy-compassion-p: in terms of being an empathetic and ethical member of the school community, being open minded and willing to change your mindset to understand that other people, with their differences, can also be right.
edu-policy-five-year-p1: - To be the preferred challenging and balanced international academic program in West-Tokyo for our target groups.
edu-policy-five-year-p2: - To be competitive in a dynamic labor and school market by having highly motivated and qualified employees that collaborate and communicate in a constructive and professional manner.
edu-policy-five-year-p3: - To be recognized as the preferred community for all international families, and Japanese families that seek an international education, in the West-Tokyo region.
edu-policy-five-year-p4: - To protect the sound financial situation and thereby securing sustainability and continued competitive quality learning.
gsa-intro: Global Step Academy is an enterprise specialized in international business, built upon the principle to “provide the foundations and opportunities for the next generation to pursue their dreams.”
gsa-li-end: Please visit our company website for further details:
yearly-h1: The school year at Tokyo West International School is rich with events from those that are held within individual grade levels to those where the entire school comes together as one. Students participate with great enthusiasm, making unforgettable memories while developing their cooperation and independence skills.
yearly-h1-span: The school year begins in April and ends in March every year.
daily-h1-span: Schedules are subject to change depending on the day of the week.
special-offers-h1: Students enrolled in GSA group schools are granted the following special offers.
special-offers-offer-1-p-2: Students can register to take up to 8 free online lessons every month with Global Step Academy.
special-offers-offer-1-p-3: (Each lesson lasts either for 25 minutes or 50 minutes depending on the students’ English skills.)
special-offers-offer-1-p-4: Language Arts and Math classes are currently available.
special-offers-offer-2-p-1: (for both Japanese international schools and overseas institutions)
special-offers-offer-2-p-2: Free school guidance services are available for students who wish to apply to
special-offers-offer-2-p-3: other international schools in Japan or abroad.
club-grey: Our students participate in club activities after school, during which students can build friendship among other club mates of different grades, learn how to support each other and work together towards a goal, and develop rich social and communication skills.
club-title: Currently we offer sports clubs such as soccer, futsal, basketball, as well as academic clubs such as music, art, and newspaper, all provided free of cost.
curriculum-grey-1: The TWIS Curriculum specifies eight learning areas: English/Kokugo (Japanese), the Arts (Music), Health and Physical Education, Learning Languages, Mathematics and Statistics, Science, Social Sciences, and TAD (Technology/Art/Design).The learning associated with each area is part of a broad, general education and lays a foundation for later specialization. Like our core values (the 4Cs), this learning is both end and means: valuable in itself and valuable for the pathways it opens to other learning. While the learning areas are presented as distinct, this does not limit the ways in which TWIS structure the learning experiences offered to our students. All learning makes use of the natural connections that exist between the various learning areas and that link learning areas to our school values.
curriculum-grey-2: All of the communication at school, except for Japanese classes, is carried out in English. Immersed in our English speaking environment, the students will naturally assimilate the correct use and pronunciation of the language through daily interaction with native English-speaking teachers and the other members of our international student community.
curriculum-icon-1-p: Students study, use, and enjoy language and literature communicated orally, visually, or in writing.
curriculum-icon-2-p: Students explore relationships in quantities, space, and data and learn to express these relationships in ways that help them to make sense of the world around them.
curriculum-icon-3-p: Students learn about their own well-being, and that of others and society, in health-related and movement contexts.
curriculum-icon-4-p: Students explore, refine, and communicate ideas as they connect thinking, imagination, senses, and feelings to create works and respond to the works of others.
curriculum-icon-5-p: Students learn to express themselves and using various modes, be innovative developers of products and systems and discerning consumers who will make a difference in the world.
curriculum-icon-6-p: Students learn to communicate in an additional language, develop their capacity to learn further languages, and explore different world views in relation to their own.
curriculum-icon-7-p: Students explore how both the natural physical world and science itself work so that they can participate as critical, informed, and responsible citizens in a society in which science plays a significant role.
curriculum-icon-8-p: Students explore how societies work and how they themselves can participate and take action as critical, informed, and responsible citizens.
contact-grey-1: Please contact us by filling out the online form below with the necessary information. After submitting the form, a confirmation email will be sent automatically.
contact-grey-2: One of our staff members will contact you by email within 2-3 days after you have submitted the form. If for any reason you do not hear back from us within 2-3 days, please contact us by phone.
contact-access-11: Access by city bus from JR Hachioji Station
contact-access-12: Access by city bus from Keio Hachioji Station
elementary-text: Our elementary faculty share responsibility for developing life-long learners and active, compassionate world citizens with a genuine commitment to affect positive change in the world.
elementary-text-2: The teachers emphasize different learning styles and the most recent research into how children learn. They build their teaching around inquiry-based units, where each unit of study has an international perspective which includes elements to develop the students' international mindedness. Our staff are there to create a safe and collaborative learning environment, and supports the students’ individual needs, encouraging them to make practical connections between their studies and the real world.
teacher-text: We’re proud of our Middle School faculty's dedication to excellence in teaching and learning. But what always impresses new students is their accessibility. Our faculty takes their commitment to outstanding teaching seriously; mentoring and giving feedback to students, and differentiating instruction to meet the individual students’ needs. We are always working overtime for you – from academic services and admissions to individual career guidance, and everywhere in between.
teacher-text-2: These factors combine to create a safe and collaborative learning environment. Our staff always supports our students’ needs, and encourages them to make practical connections between their studies and the real world.
secretary-text: We have a small team of experienced staff in the office who closely follow each and every student/ parents whenever necessary. School office works in conjunction with the school administration, teachers, accountants, students and parents to keep our school the center of excellence that it has become.
tour-intro: We hold school tours on weekdays upon request. On the school tour, we will show you around our facilities, explain about our curriculum and policies and answer any questions you may have. Please do not hesitate to contact us to book your visit by clicking on the link below.
tour-li-1: Explain about our school and the GSA group
tour-li-end: If you would like to schedule a visit to our school, please contact us by filling out the form below.
tour-li-grey: ※ We ask that you schedule your school tour prior to your visit.
steps-p-2: - Progress Report from previous or current school
steps-p-3: - Graduation Certificate or Certificate of Student Status from previous or current school
steps-p-4: - Non-Japanese parents and legal guardians will be required to submit a copy of their Residence Card.
steps-p-5: Admission Selection Process / application fee: 20,000 yen (including tax)
steps-p-6: Tokyo West International School will only accept students who have English language capabilities that will allow them to follow, learn and actively participate in school activities. However, if a student agrees to participate in the Boost Program, they can be accepted into TWIS without fulfilling the English requirement of the entrance examination.
steps-p-7: - Tokyo West International School will inform those who have fulfilled the examination requirements with an acceptance letter. Prospective students who have passed the screening and have paid the entrance fee by the deadline will be considered enrolled. Please note that once you have paid the enrollment fee, it will not be refunded under any circumstances. Before enrollment, students will receive a school book and we will organize an orientation session.
steps-p-8: - We welcome siblings of current students who are interested in enrolling at our school.
tuition-row-4-2: (medical examination fees, disaster prevention costs, etc.)
tuition-text-1: - Entrance Examination and Application Fees: ¥20,000 (includes tax)
tuition-text-2: - Basic fees (all fees are in Japanese yen) are common to all grades
tuition-text-3: - Tuition can also be paid by term (three months).
tuition-text-4: - Other fees (all fees are in Japanese yen)
facility-gallery-h1-p: Tokyo West provides a healthy and safe learning environment. Our new Hachioji campus was completed in 2015, and has been built according to the most advanced safety standards. From the windows of our bright classrooms, the students can enjoy the changing of the seasons and the view of the surrounding greenery.
bus-h1-1: It takes 10 minutes from Hachioji, 30 minutes from Tachikawa, 40 minutes from Tamagawa-Jyosui, 40 minutes from Tama Center, 45 minutes from Kunitachi, and 60 minutes from Machida to get to school.
bus-h1-2: Please arrive at the bus stop at least 5 minutes in advance for pickups.
security-icon-1-p: Visitors are asked to present their photo ID at the front office. We are fully equipped with smoke detectors and fire extinguishers.
security-icon-2-p: We have a health care room on the second floor of Annex building (adjacent to our main building), with a resident school nurse.
security-icon-3-p: We participate in safety trainings held by the fire/disaster prevention manager of Tokyo Fire Department regularly, and have submitted a disaster prevention plan to the Tokyo Fire Department. We always inform new parents about our emergency routes upon their student’s admission to school.
security-icon-3-p-2: We do monthly emergency drills according to our emergency protocol in order to be prepared in case of natural disasters, such as earthquakes, fire, and other emergencies. Upon our emergency drills, we simulate different situations to efficiently guide children to act accordingly and evacuate safely.
boost-intro: We offer a boost program for prospective students who need to development their English skills in order to actively participate in the lessons at TWIS. Children who do not meet the administration criteria, but depending on their performance in the entrance examination, may be eligible to enroll into our school if they agree to participate in this program. The goal of the Boost program is to increase the amount of English input to facilitate the language learning and raising the English levels so that the student can become more of an independent learner who can actively participate in their classes.
boost-p-1: After returning home from school, students will be expected to take a 50 minute online English lesson everyday (30 times/month). This is a one-on-one individual program, and the student’s online lesson records and information will be shared with teachers of TWIS to monitor their progress. Students are able to participate in this program while attending their regular classes at TWIS.
boost-p-2: Students will take Global Step Academy’s English Language Arts online lesson. Please refer to the GSA homepage for details.
boost-p-3: This program is only for specific students who have a certain level of English but doesn’t meet the TWIS criteria. We take students on a rolling basis allowing for students to participate in our program in the middle of the school year.
boost-box-p-1: G1 (6 years old) - G5 (10 years old)
boost-box-p-3: ※ The duration si subject to change, depending on how the student advances to the targeted English grade level.
boost-box-p-5: - 50 minute lesson x 30 times a month分
boost-box-p-6: ※The fee is separate from the school fees for Tokyo West International School.
boost-link: Please click on the link below for details.
elm-h1: The educational leadership group organizes and maintains the general management of all GSA schools. The group takes responsibility for activating the school improvement plan through school-based professional learning and monitors progress.
elm-ivan-p: He graduated from St. John's University and Stony Brook University. He had been teaching math, sociology, English/French etc for more than 10 years at international schools. He also has a New York Teacher Certification. After establishing an English school, joined GLOBAL EDUCATIONAL PARTNERS, Inc as COO in May 2015.
elm-john-p: He has more than 40 years of teaching experience at major international schools in Tokyo. He is a professional member of IECA (The International Childbirth Education Association), and supported over 100 high school & college students to study abroad. Also, he has teacher's license from California State. In November 2006, he founded GLOBAL EDUCATIONAL PARTNERS, Inc
elm-morten-p: He has graduated from Oslo University (MusB.Ed), Bergen University (Cand.Philol), Tokyo University of Fine Arts (M.Ed obtained, and EdD retired with credits) and Tamagawa University (IBEC). Has worked more than 10 years in both public and private school systems in both Norway and Japan, and as an assistant professor at the University of Oslo. Currently enrolled in the Ontario Universities Principal's Qualification Program while working as the Head of School for TWIS/GSA.
elm-chris-p: He has graduated from Massey University (PGCE) Universal college of Learning (BESS) and Universal College of Learning (CHP). Has worked in education for 8 years in Japan and previously as a S&C coach for young athletes in New Zealand. He also has experience working in extensive outdoor education programs at a High school level and is a trained practitioner in the IB Middle school program.
elm-yukiko-p: She has been an entrepreneur in education for over two decades.  She started and built two Japanese programs in the San Francisco Bay area: one for gifted-talented middle school students and another for a private high school.  In Japan she has co-founded an organization providing design thinking education and curricula to schools across Japan, has taught Japanese at the high school level, is a qualified language examiner in IB, and joined the GSA group in June, 2018.
privacy-1: Tokyo   WestInternationalSchool   (the   'School') will manage   the personal information that  the  School  holds and  handle itin  accordance  with  the  following policy(the  'Policy'). Terms  which  are  defined  in  this  Policy  have  the  same meaning as  given  to  those  terms  inthe Act  on  the  Protection  of  Personal Information and relatedlawsand regulations.
privacy-3: In this Policy, personal information that the School holds means information which is provided verbally  or  in  writing by the students  or  their  parents, or information which  is obtained through the  School's daily activities. Information  that is spontaneously  provided  by  the  students  or  their  parents  during  class  or through personal  contact with the school's personnel outside  class is not deemed to  be information that the School possesses (Please refer to Section 9).
privacy-4: 2. Purpose of Use of Personal Information
privacy-5: (1) The  School  will use  personal  information within  the below stated scope  of purpose  of use or for  other  purposes clearly  stated (if  any) and will  not  use the information for any other purpose without the consent of the individual concernedor except  as permitted  by applicable law. If  anyamendment is  to  be  made to the purposes of  use,  the  School  will notify  the content  of  the  amendment  to  the principal or publish the amendments through the School's website.The School will use personal information to:
privacy-6: (a) conduct activities regarding attracting  students  to the School  and entry into the School;
privacy-10: (e) plan, and notify students of, class schedules, etc.;
privacy-11: (f) distribute information regarding services (newsletter, campaigns and questionnaires, etc.);
privacy-12: (g) distribute information regarding services that the School provides;
privacy-14: (i) correctly understand opinions and inquiries about the School's services, and to respond;
privacy-15: (j) research and analyze customer trends and product development, etc.;
privacy-16: (k) confirm  the  identity of  the  students when disclosure of  personal information is requested;
privacy-17: (l) contact students and  respond  appropriately inemergency situations such as disasters;
privacy-18: (m) settle fees for the use of services and to collect delayed payments, etc.
privacy-19: (2) Except asset  forthin  Article  16,  Paragraph  3 of the Act  on  the  Protection  of Personal Information, the School will not use personal information for any purpose not described  in this Policy unless  the  School  obtains  prior  consent  from  the principal.
privacy-20: 3. Protection and Management of Personal Information
privacy-21: The  School recognizes the  importance  of  handling  personal  information and, to guarantee the right of  the students  and  their parents concerning their personal information, the School will:
privacy-22: (a) comply with the Act on the Protection of Personal Information and related laws and regulations;
privacy-23: (b) take  reasonable safety  measures both from a technical  and organizational perspective to  prevent  risks  such  asleakage, loss, defamationor falsification of personal information;
privacy-24: (c) set  up a  point  of contact  to  respond  to  and  settle  any  questions  regarding its handling of personal information promptly and in good faith; and
privacy-25: (d) regularly review and  continuously  revise its information  security system to ensure its appropriate handling of the personal information.
privacy-26: 4. Provision and Sharing of Personal Information to a Third Party
privacy-27: (1) In principle, the School will not provide or share personal information to a third party without obtaining the prior consent of the principal, except:
privacy-28: (a)in cases of joint usage as set forth in Section 5;
privacy-29: (b) asset forth in Article 23, Paragraph 1of the Act on the Protection of Personal Information;
privacy-30: (c) where it is necessary to take measures,including legislative measures, in response to violations of the School's regulations by the students or their parents;
privacy-31: (d) where the  Schoolreceivesa  courtwarrantor  effective  order  by a public  institution  such  as the police to  disclose personal information pursuant to applicable laws and regulations; and
privacy-32: (e)in  any  other  case  which fulfillsthe  other requirements of  applicable laws and regulations.
privacy-33: (2) If personal  data is  provided to  a  third  party (excluding third  parties that have established as ystem which conforms to the standards  prescribed  by the  Personal Information  Protection  Commission regarding the handling  of  personal  data) in  a foreign   country (excluding those   prescribed by   the   rules   of   the   Personal Information  Protection  Commission  as being a  foreign  country with a  personal information  protection  system  recognized  to  have  equivalent  standards  to  that  in Japan in regard to the protection of an individual's rights and interests), except for cases set forth in each item of Article 23, Paragraph 1of the Act on the Protection of  Personal  Information,the  School will obtain consent from  the principleto provide  the personal data,  or consent to  provide the  personal  data in  accordance with the related sections of this Policy.
privacy-34: 5. Joint Usage of Personal Information with Business Partners
privacy-35: The  School  collaborates with  business  partners  in  order  to  provide  each  student with a more effective education. Therefore, the   School will   use   personal information jointly with its business partners within the scope set forth below.  The School appreciates your understanding about joint usageas the School continues its efforts to strictly manage joint use of personal information.
privacy-36: (1) Scope of personal data to be jointly used
privacy-37: Name, gender, date of birth, address, telephone number, email address, and records kept by the School at the time of enrollment of the student.
privacy-38: [However, 'Special  care-required personal  information'(Article  2,  paragraph  3  of the Act on the Protection of Personal Information) is excluded.]
privacy-40: GLOBAL EDUCATIONAL PARTNERS INC.   and   its   affiliates,   as   well   as educational  business  operators  who are  business  partners  of  the  School  whose services are to be used by students or their parents.
privacy-41: [*The School will not provide information to business partners whodo not have a connection with students and their parents.]
privacy-45: (a)Creating curriculums,  providing  prior  information  to  teachers, providing services such as analysis of the results of examinations.
privacy-46: (b)Distributing information in  relation  to  services  (newsletters, campaigns, surveys, etc.).
privacy-47: (c)Analyzing customer trends, researching for product development, etc.
privacy-48: (4) Entity responsible for managing personal data
privacy-50: (5) The School will also jointly use the records created by business partners when providing its service, in order to provide better services.
privacy-52: Students  or  their  parentsare  responsible for providing accurate  and  up-to-datepersonal information.
privacy-54: (1)  When the  School receives a  request  for the disclosure  of its retained  personal data, the  School will  disclose  the  data  to  the principal,
privacy-55: except wherethere  is  a possibility of causing serious damage to the School's proper business implementation.
privacy-56: (2) When the School receives a request for the modification, addition or deletion of the  contents of its retained  personal  data, the  School will conduct  anecessary investigation  to ensure  that the  purposes  of its useof  the  data  is  being  complied with, and modify the data based on the results of the investigation.
privacy-57: (3)  When the  School receives a  request  for the suspension  of  use,  deletion  or suspension of provision to third parties of its retained personal data, the School will suspend the use of such data if the request proves to be legitimate.
privacy-58: (4)  For  requests  for  disclosure  set out in  items (1) to  (3) above,  please contact the point ofcontact listed in Article 11.
privacy-59: 8. Usage of Photographs in Booklet and Website
privacy-60: When the School uses data from a photograph taken at the School in booklets and websites, the School will comply strictly with the following.
privacy-61: (1) If the  School uses a  photograph in which  an  individual  is  identifiable, the School will obtain the consent of the individual concerned.
privacy-62: (2) If the School receivesa request for modification or suspension of the use of the photograph, the School will deal with the matter promptly.
privacy-64: As  set  forth  in  Article  1,  the  information  provided  personally  from  students  and their parents to teachers is not personal information retained by the School and such information  shall  not be personal  information  to  be  protected  and  managed  under this Policy.    Therefore,  the  School is  not  liable for any leak or loss of such information.
privacy-66: Except where required  by  laws  and  regulations,  the  School  may  revise this Policy from  time  to  time by  announcing the  revisionon the School's website,  without obtaining the prior consent of the principal.
privacy-68: 11. The point of contact for complaints, inquiries and disclosure requests regarding the handling of personal information is:
testimonial-shiori: We decided to send our daughter to TWIS because we liked that the school is close to our house. We also liked that the school provides lunch and that there is a nurse stationed at the school. We feel the teachers are fully aware of each students’ characteristics and pay very close attention to them.
testimonial-shiori-reveal: We are glad to see students always looking happy in the pictures. In regards to the curriculum, the classes are based on monthly themes which makes the classes look very appealing and fulfilling from the parents’ eye. Our daughter especially likes the Music Class and we hear her humming songs that she learned at school.
testimonial-hoggatt: We find it appealing that the teachers always pay close attention to the students. The school informs us on our daughter’s performance and development at school through Class Dojo. We also really like that they have birthday parties for all the students in our daughter's class.
testimonial-hoggatt-reveal: Some of our daughter’s favorite school events are the holiday presentations, the Halloween event, and Christmas song and dance performances. Our daughter always looks forward to the field trips as well! As for classes, we really like that they use the Jolly Phonics. It suits our daughter’s reading and writing studies. We love this school!
testimonial-noel: We decided to enroll our daughter to TWIS after being recommended by parents of a student already enrolled in the school. We feel that the compatibility of the teachers and our daughter is fantastic. The curriculum is very fulfilling and we like that it includes PE and Music classes.
testimonial-noel-reveal: Our daughter’s favorite classes are art and science, but I personally like Class Dojo. Adding to this, we really like that the school offers many field trips!
testimonial-hugo: Physical education at TWIS is supposed to be inclusive and lifelong. Physical education is for everyone and at TWIS we encourage every student regardless of their skill level to participate in PE; as we believe that students will try to become active outside school if those experiences during the year are positive.
testimonial-hugo-pires: I hope you enjoy and excel in our physical education program and utilise the knowledge and skills learned through each activity for your success and future endeavour.
testimonial-kath: All of my students possess a unique and insightful understanding of themselves and the world. They are fundamental to the positive and internationally focused culture of TWIS. Their hard work and tenacity inspires me to be a better educator.
testimonial-kath-reveal: TWIS is a great place that challenges teachers to become more effective and creative in order to encourage meaningful learning and foster globally minded, lifelong learners.
testimonial-maki: I want to make sure that every student is able to focus on one’s learning by providing peace of mind that help is always available.
testimonial-maki-reveal: TWIS is a friendly community of learners where everyone knows everyone. TWIS faculty and students work very closely with each other to achieve common goals and strive to grow in every aspect of school life. TWIS students are energetic, curious, and love to have fun through learning.
news-1-content: 2019 Grade 1 Admission Guidance Tokyo West International School
news-2-content: An international school will newly open in April 2019 along with Honda Keisuke’s KSK group. We have published the press release on PR TIMES.
news-3-content: Tokyo Global Summer School 2018 where students can enjoy experiencing a real American summer school with American kids will open this summer.
